title: The Life and Times of Barney Miller
description: When a drug addict holds the precinct hostage, Captain Barney Miller has to talk him out of it.

title: Ramon
description: When a drug addict holds the precinct hostage, Captain Barney Miller has to talk him out of it.

title: Experience
description: A bomber targets the 12th Precinct. Fish contemplates retirement.

title: Snow Job
description: The squad guards a department store payroll. A flasher attempts suicide in the bathroom.

title: Graft
description: Barney's friend is assigned to investigate allegations of corruption in the 12th precinct. Chano pursues an obscene phone caller.

title: The Courtesans
description: A prostitute threatens harassment charges against Wojo. Rachel wants her own apartment.

title: Stakeout
description: Nosy neighbors interfere with a stakeout operation.

title: Bureaucrat
description: Among others, the 12th hosts a drunken bureaucrat and the 12-year-old who robbed Chano's apartment. Wojo forces the precinct's favorite deli closed for minor health code infractions.

title: Ms. Cop
description: An overeager female officer disrupts the all-male squad. Chano arrests an obscene phone caller.

title: Vigilante
description: Inspector Luger visits Barney to complain that the public doesn't dislike his men enough. Wojo arrests a cross-dressing teamster. A neighborhood vigilante is "over the hill."

title: The Guest
description: The Precinct reluctantly guards a Mafia witness. Chano uses his fellow officers' cash reserve to set up a narcotics buy.

title: Escape Artist
description: Barney holds a resourceful escaped prisoner for the FBI. A self-declared "bird-man" drops in. Harris decides to write a novel.

title: Hair
description: A Serpico replica joins the squad temporarily. Bernice discovers that Fish spent the afternoon in a massage parlor.

title: The Hero
description: Chano kills two bank robbers. Liz makes a citizen's arrest of her assailant -- an eight-year-old boy.

title: Doomsday
description: A disgruntled man wearing a belt of dynamite threatens to detonate himself and the squad room. Wojo arrests a fraudulent priest. The squad room plumbing goes haywire.

title: The Social Worker
description: Liz tires of housework and tries her hand at social work, to Barney's dismay. Harris is intrigued by a master forger.

title: The Layoff
description: A city-wide labor layoff forces Barney, Fish, and Yemana to do without the services of Chano, Harris and Wojo. A morose stockbroker resorts to petty theft.

title: Ambush
description: Yemana is shot in plain sight of disinterested bystanders. Barney is offered a job in Florida.

title: Heat Wave
description: A wife claims spousal abuse. Wojo and Wentworth go undercover to catch a park rapist.

title: The Arsonist
description: The officers look out for an arsonist. Chano arrests a man who assaulted a vending machine with a deadly weapon.

title: Grand Hotel
description: Wojo and Wentworth go undercover as a married couple to break up a burglary ring set in an upscale hotel.

title: Discovery
description: Marty claims that a member of the precinct is harassing the gay community. The precinct computers have recorded Fish as dead.

title: You Dirty Rat
description: Two kilos of confiscated marijuana disappears from the evidence locker. A homeless man spends his nights in a a series of department stores.

title: Horse Thief
description: A hansom cab owner reports his horse as missing. A man is assaulted in his hotel room; yet he insists he was alone.

title: Rain
description: The squad must work through the precinct roof threatening to collapse from the rain and a nightclub comic's Bicentennial jokes.

title: Fish
description: A look at Fish's home life results when he decides to go on restricted duty. Steve Landesberg steps in as Arthur Dietrich. Doris Belack substitutes for Florence Stanley as Bernice Fish.

title: Hot Dogs
description: A man is convinced that a photo of Jean Harlow is of his missing wife. A pair of female officers makes an overzealous drug bust.

title: Protection
description: Citizens are in a panic over rumors that the 12th Precinct is being shut down. A repentant hood can't prove that he committed a crime.

title: Happy New Year
description: On New Year's Eve, Wojo delivers a baby, and Fish tries to stop a jumper.

title: The Sniper
description: Wojo and Luger become targets of a sniper. A con man is selling charter flights to Saturn.

title: Fear of Flying
description: Although Wojo is afraid of flying, he must escort a bigamist to Cleveland. Meanwhile, the bigamist's New York wife turns up at the precinct. A man turns in an unmarked envelope containing $3,500 in cash, anxious to know when he will able to claim it.

title: Block Party
description: Wentworth is furious when Chano gets the credit for the arrest she made of an assassin at a block party.

title: Massage Parlor
description: Wentworth arrests a dime-store cowboy in a massage parlor. The detectives arrest an mugger who's in her eighties.

title: The Psychiatrist
description: A psychiatrist advises the department to confiscate Wojo's gun.

title: The Kid
description: Fish is attracted to a mugger's mother. A man who turned in $3,500 he found a few weeks ago is anxious to know whether the owner has claimed it.

title: The Mole
description: A burglar known as "The Mole" leads Harris and Wojo on a chase through the city sewer system. Fish considers an operation.

title: Evacuation
description: Wojo is alarmed to learn that New York City doesn't have an up-to-date emergency evacuation procedure. Fish meets Jilly Pappalardo, a young thief who eventually will star in the spin-off Fish.

title: Quarantine: Part 1
description: Wojo brings in a sick perpetrator who collapses on the floor. The entire precinct is placed under quarantine, including a prostitute who gets friendly with Fish, Marty, Mr Driscoll, and Inspector Luger.

title: Quarantine: Part 2
description: Being cooped up in the same room together, especially with no air conditioning, starts to effect the men negatively. Especially when they overhear Harris' very vocal dreams where he seems to have a problem with everyone. The rest of the men share personal stories and conversations,while waiting to hear from the medical lab if the the possible "pox" they might be infected with is either Small Pox or Chicken Pox.

title: Bus Stop
description: A robber is confined to the precinct with his bus load of victims.

title: The Election
description: It's Election Day. A woman, being prevented by her husband from voting, throws a toilet seat into the street to get attention. A shoplifter is escorted to vote by Wojo and then lost by him. Inspector Luger campaigns for a political crony.

title: Werewolf
description: A man claiming to be a werewolf causes a disturbance in the park.

title: The Recluse
description: A man who hasn't left his apartment since World War II is brought in for refusing to serve jury duty. A prophet claims the end is near, i.e. 5:30 p.m.

title: Noninvolvement
description: Wojo brings in a man for refusing to help a mugging victim, but Barney doesn't think a crime has been committed.

title: Power Failure
description: The precinct endures a power failure and a man with a split personality.

title: Christmas Story
description: Fish goes undercover to catch a mugger who's targeting Santas. Wojo doesn't know how to tell Yemana that his Christmas Eve date is a call girl. Luger fishes for an Christmas Day invitation from Barney.

title: Hash
description: Everyone on the squad except Barney is stoned by hashish-laced brownies made by Wojo's new girlfriend. An actor and a critic duel with swords.

title: Smog Alert
description: The city experiences a first-stage smog alert. A potential suicide victim is saved by a graffiti artist.

title: Community Relations
description: Barney is charged with harassment when he arrests a blind shoplifter. An evicted tenant threatens a landlord with a musket.

title: The Rand Report
description: Wojo quits the force rather than return to uniformed patrol one week per month.

title: Fire '77
description: Thanks to a suicidal couple, the precinct may go up in flames.

title: Abduction
description: A couple wants Barney's assistance with their cult-influenced daughter. Nick's bookie is arrested. Harris gets a short story published in a slick gentleman's magazine. Bernice interviews for a job over Fish's objections.

title: Sex Surrogate
description: Barney investigates a sex clinic that more closely resembles a brothel. Harris investigates a rash of crimes apparently committed by a juvenile. Weary of waiting for a promotion, Levitt announces that he's quitting the force.

title: Moonlighting
description: Barney discovers that Harris has a second job. Dietrich arrests a priest for fencing stolen goods. A racketeer is using a mentally challenged boy as an assistant.

title: Asylum
description: Wojo prematurely grants asylum to a Russian defector. Marty is charged with a parole violation for possessing a half-ounce of marijuana.

title: Group Home
description: Yemana assists a bigoted Army officer when a bomber threatens a recruiting facility. Fish takes a turn at mugging detail.

title: Strike: Part 1
description: The city is threatened with a police force strike. A woman is robbed by her computer date.

title: Strike: Part 2
description: Barney and Inspector Luger staff the precinct alone while the detectives are on strike.

title: Good-Bye, Mr. Fish: Part 1
description: Fish is nowhere to be found on his last day before he retires. A neighborhood vigilante group is out of control.

title: Good-Bye, Mr. Fish: Part 2
description: Fish finally reports for work but refuses to acknowledge that he is obligated to retire.

title: Bugs
description: Recording devices discovered in the precinct may have come from Internal Affairs or the White House.

title: Corporation
description: An environmentalist who has been attacking a chemical plant faces the corporation's high-priced lawyer.

title: Burial
description: Retired Detective Fish returns to assist Barney in locating a kidnapped corpse.

title: Copy Cat
description: Yemana uses a TV Guide to second-guess the perpetrator who's mimicking crime shows. An alcoholic forgets his weapon in the commission of a hold-up.

title: Blizzard
description: A blizzard traps the precinct with a corpse. A self-proclaimed prophet predicts a new ice age.

title: Chase
description: Wojo crashes a borrowed cab chasing a robbery suspect. Lieutenant Scanlon uses a drug pusher to try to flush out corruption in the precinct.

title: Thanksgiving Story
description: The detectives clean up the mess after three mental patients have Thanksgiving dinner at a laundromat.

title: Tunnel
description: When a tunnel collapses, Wojo is buried alive along with a burglar digging toward a diamond exchange. Though he is currently homeless, Harris searches Manhattan for an apartment to fit his intended lifestyle.

title: Atomic Bomb
description: A college student's physics project is really a functional atomic bomb.

roles.char: Mr. Swanson of Metropolitan New York Cryonic Society

title: The Bank
description: A man wants a sperm bank charged with murder after the bank's lab accidentally destroys the man's last available sample.

title: The Ghost
description: The police do not believe a man who claims he's being visited by a poltergeist. Then they put the man in jail, and strange events begin occurring about the squad room.

title: Appendicitis
description: Yemana is hospitalized with appendicitis. Guests to the jail include a sugar addict and an aging bounty hunter.

title: Rape
description: A woman wants her husband arrested on a rape charge. A master of disguise perpetuates a crime spree. To Yemana's delight, the city legalizes off-track betting.

title: Eviction: Part 1
description: Barney defies authority and refuses to evict the tenants of a condemned hotel. Luger tries to decide how to spend his vacation time.

title: Eviction: Part 2
description: A SWAT team is now involved with the hotel situation. Dietrich learns the identity of his amnesic girlfriend.

title: Wojo's Problem
description: Barney would rather not know the details of Wojo's most recent difficulty. The new female detective's husband is suspicious of her co-workers. A shoplifter escapes-in a wheelchair.

title: Quo Vadis?
description: Barney's been shot! The startling news paralyzes the precinct with dread and provokes Liz to draw the line. An elderly woman strenuously objects to the nude paintings on display in an art gallery.

title: Hostage
description: A prisoner holds the squad at gunpoint. A ventriloquist insists he's not responsible for his dummy's insensitive remarks. Harris finally finds an apartment in the Village.

title: Evaluation
description: A porno shop reporting vandalism turns out to be a mom-and-pop operation being hassled by the parents' children. Harris arrests a numerologist who will only give his name as "1223." The squad members await their evaluations.

title: The Sighting
description: A man liquidates all of his assets into gold, much to his wife's dismay. Wojo claims he saw a UFO over Staten Island.

title: Inauguration
description: Harris does some intensive soul searching when he's offered a job on the mayor's security team.

title: Kidnapping: Part 1
description: A political activist kidnaps a department store magnate. Wojo arrests a prostitute and her business manager.

title: Kidnapping: Part 2
description: Wojo delivers the ransom money for the kidnapped department store owner. The prostitute charms Wojo and the victim's son.

title: The Search
description: The officers reopen a 28-year-old missing persons case. The host of a children's science show goes berserk. Harris takes a turn at cross-dressing mugging detail.

title: Dog Days
description: Wojo is bitten by a German Shepherd that may be rabid. The Millers prepare for their impending separation.

title: The Baby Broker
description: A German woman attempts to escape the country rather than surrender her baby to a baby broker's clients. Levitt resorts to stimulants to maintain his self-imposed thirty-six-hour shift.

title: The Accusation
description: An accusation against Dietrich leads to a visit from Lieutenant Scanlon of Internal Affairs. Yemana arrests a rabbi who is running a gambling casino in his synagogue.

title: The Prisoner
description: A prisoner released after serving his sentence has difficulty adjusting to civilian life. A cat burglar's widow continues the family business.

title: Loan Shark
description: Harris arrests a young loan shark. Barney notes some uncharacteristic behavior from Yemana. A tattoo artist refuses to remove his work from a client.

title: The Vandal
description: Barney suspects Levitt of vandalizing the squad room. A TV programming executive is assaulted in a coffee shop.

title: The Harris Incident
description: A rookie cop assumes Harris is a felon and shoots at him. A stockbroker leaves Wall Street to become a beggar.

title: The Radical
description: A shoplifting suspect turns out to be a wanted 1960s-era radical, whose raging about the Vietnam War stirs up passions and polarizes the precinct. An overweight burglar becomes the butt of jokes.

title: Toys
description: Combatting toy makers create a disturbance. A claustrophobic prisoner has a problem with the jail cell. Barney faces his first holiday as a separated man.

title: The Indian
description: Wojo is forced to arrest an aging Indian who only wants to die in the park. A woman's shoes are stolen-from her feet.

title: Voice Analyzer
description: Lieutenant Scanlon tries to hunt corruption with a lie detector. Barney suspects a furrier's robbery report.

title: The Spy
description: A paranoid spy holds the squad room at bay. The officers bring in a disorderly mime.

title: Wojo's Girl: Part 1
description: Wojo decides to move in with his girlfriend. A man tells his wife that he's leaving to become a mercenary.

title: Wojo's Girl: Part 2
description: Wojo struggles to co-exist with his girlfriend, a former prostitute.

title: Middle Age
description: Barney feels the aging process. Dietrich arrests an aging Olympic hopeful who practices his javelin toss in Central Park. A Hassidic Jew is the target of a diamond thief.

title: The Counterfeiter
description: Harris pumps a counterfeiter for his life story. A man takes exception to a cosmetic surgeon's work on his wife.

title: Open House
description: The precinct hosts an open house that attracts only vagrants. Wojo and Harris try to get a lead on an arsonist. Barney's enthusiasm in moving back home is tempered by the hotel manager who refuses to refund him his upcoming month's rent.

title: Identity
description: The precinct is asked to assist a thief who is entering a witness relocation program. Harris quickly regrets the fact that Dietrich has saved his life.

title: Computer Crime
description: A computer firm has difficulty retrieving embezzled funds. An educated young man claims to be under the influence of a voodoo curse.

title: Graveyard Shift
description: The squad face the late shift with an irate tourist and a man who believes that he is being frequented by a succubus.

title: Jack Soo, a Retrospective
description: The death of Jack Soo in 1979 marked the passing of both a fine comedy actor and one of TV's most memorable characters: Nick Yemana, the deadpan detective known for his dry wit and wretched coffee. This tribute to Soo features reminiscences by the series regulars as well as some notable Yemana vignettes--Nick's curious response to an ink-blot test administered by a police psychiatrist; his attraction to a Japanese woman who turns out to be a hooker; and his inability to stop singing after he innocently eats brownies laced with hashish.

title: Inquisition
description: Lieutenant Scanlon investigates an anonymous letter that identifies a member of the precinct as a homosexual. An angry shopper destroys to an elevator's MUZAK machine.

title: The Photographer
description: A prisoner claims to be Jesus Christ. A drug dealer is caught with a large stash. An elderly mugger poses as a photographer to entice lonely women.

title: Vacation
description: The detectives are preoccupied with Barney's posted vacation schedules. A string of false alarms suggests that a sniper may be after a cop. A man won't donate a kidney to his ailing brother.

title: The Brother
description: A monk suffers a transgression with a prostitute. Dietrich may not be ideal for mugging detail, especially if in drag.

title: The Slave
description: Harris objects to the fact that the Burmese chauffeur being arrested for a traffic accident is actually an indentured servant.

title: Strip Joint
description: A bookstore owner is angry when a strip club opens near his store. A man is convinced that he is on the verge of spontaneous combustion.

title: The Bird
description: The clerk that sold Wojo a sick bird changes his strict no-return policy when he learns that the detective is a police officer. A suicide hot line operator becomes suicidal. Harris's book publication is interrupted when Dietrich refuses to sign a release.

title: The Desk
description: A former master criminal becomes incoherent following his lobotomy. A victim is unable to use the telephone to report being mugged because he's Amish.

title: The Judge
description: A judge overrules an attorney by hitting him on the head with a gavel. A woman reports crimes that actually happen on soap operas.

title: The DNA Story
description: The squad searches for a viral strain stolen from a lab. A woman is convinced that her husband is really a clone.

title: The Dentist
description: A detective goes undercover to trap a dentist with instruments that seem to go missing. One man's hands are a nuisance to others and a musical instrument to himself.

title: People's Court
description: Weary apartment dwellers band together to catch a burglar. A census taker takes drastic measures to count an unco-operative target.

title: Vanished: Part 1
description: Harris poses as a vagrant to go undercover to solve a string of crimes, and then he disappears. A woman wants Wojo or Dietrich to make a baby with her.

title: Vanished: Part 2
description: Harris disappears while going undercover as a vagrant. Luger chooses to be demoted rather than to retire.

title: The Child Stealers
description: Marty's friend Mr. Driscoll tries to reclaim his son by kidnapping him from a playground. A self-proclaimed time traveler advises Harris to adjust his stock portfolio.

title: Guns
description: A rash of unusual robberies leads to an eccentric gun collector. A man who is trying to recover his television set robs the police vault. Wojo fears that a depressed Luger is planning to commit suicide.

title: Uniform Day
description: The staff serve the annual department-mandated ritual day in uniform, except Harris who wears his customary three-piece suit.

title: Dietrich's Arrest: Part 1
description: Dietrich is arrested for participating in an anti-nuclear rally. A lottery winner dispenses of his prize money by throwing it out a window. Barney discovers he can't afford his apartment now that it is being converted into a condominium.

title: Dietrich's Arrest: Part 2
description: Harris is assigned to book Dietrich, whose arrest earns a visit from Internal Affairs. A nuclear engineer is arrested for splashing participants with atomic water.

title: The Architect
description: An architect decides to blow up his own building.

title: The Inventor
description: An inventor steals the plans for his own invention. The squad tries hypnosis to uncover the name of a criminal that Wojo can't remember.

title: Fog
description: Barney is discouraged at being passed over yet again for promotion to the rank of deputy inspector.

title: Homicide: Part 1
description: The department restructures precincts into specialty squads. Luger gets the 12th assigned as a homicide squad. A man murders his barber. A woman hires a hit man to kill her husband and then changes her mind.

title: Homicide: Part 2
description: Barney's frustration boils over when the new homicide-only edict results in the death of an old friend. Dietrich tracks down the hit man's intended target. Harris woos the precinct's crime photographer.

title: The Delegate
description: A drunk and disorderly man turns out to be a delegate from the 1976 Democratic convention. Barney discovers that the newly assigned Officer Nash is not really a police officer.

title: Dorsey
description: The precinct's newest detective is convinced that his colleagues are on the take and asks not to be included.

title: Agent Orange
description: Wojo takes a personal interest in a fellow vet whose crime spree may be related to Agent Orange exposure during the Vietnam War. A domestic dispute occurs at the Brauer household when their apartment building becomes "clothing optional."

title: Call Girl
description: The precinct is besieged by a large group of prostitutes. Dorsey develops a protective stance with a young one. Harris receives stock tips from another. Dietrich is tempted by all of them as he experiments with celibacy.

title: Resignation
description: Dietrich feels guilty and resigns when he shoots a felon. A playwright assaults an incompetent actor.

title: Field Associate
description: The detectives are edgy because someone is sending specific information about them to Internal Affairs. Harris sets up a reunion between an elderly cat burglar and his wife who reported him missing years ago.

title: Movie: Part 1
description: Harris is assigned to direct a pornographic movie for an investigation. An former-generation radio news reporter assaults a young television anchor.

title: Movie: Part 2
description: Audience members at the screening of Harris' over-budget film include a blind mugging victim and an overeager charity collector.

title: The Psychic
description: A mugger claims he was following a psychic vision. A language professor vandalizes a grammatically incorrect billboard.

title: Stormy Weather
description: Barney anxiously waits for news about Wojo who chased a looter into the Hudson River. A deaf woman is arrested for prostitution.

title: The Librarian
description: A gypsy has an incredibly compelling motive for harassing the owner of a novelty store. A librarian takes extreme measures to enforce quiet among her patrons.

title: Rachel
description: Wojo asks Barney's daughter out on a date. A sporting goods store owner takes the law in his own hands. Arnold Ripner sues Harris over the lawyer's portrayal in the detective's novel.

title: Contempt: Part 1
description: Barney is charged with contempt of court when he refuses to name an informant. A restaurant may have refused to serve a man because of his appearance.

title: Contempt: Part 2
description: While Barney spends the night in jail for contempt of court, Harris supervises the squad room.

title: The Doll
description: An expensive doll is abducted for ransom. A man claims he was swindled out of a ticket on the space shuttle. Luger names Barney as a beneficiary in his will.

title: Lady and the Bomb
description: A woman threatens to blow up the squad room with a homemade bomb. The jury reaches a verdict in Harris's libel suit. Retired Detective Phil Fish drops in for a visit.

title: Riot
description: Luger turns a small disturbance with the Hassidic community into a full-blown riot. The squad discovers a survivalist couple setting up their housekeeping in the sewers.

title: The Vests
description: The detectives object to wearing their new bulletproof vests. Luger interviews the detectives in case of the need for an obituary.

title: The Rainmaker
description: The officers arrest a rainmaker, only to discover that he was hired by the drought-ridden city. Wojo, Harris, and Dietrich each consider applying for a job opening in vice.

title: Liquidation
description: Harris is forced to liquidate his possessions to pay the judgment in Arnold Ripner's lawsuit.

title: Paternity
description: Wojo is proved innocent in a paternity suit, but at a price. An angry patron vandalizes a theater. A beauty queen is robbed.

title: Advancement
description: Harris signs a contract for a new book. A lottery winner seeks revenge when the ticket seller loses his winning ticket. Luger manipulates Barney into writing a letter to his mail-order bride.

title: The Car
description: A car thief's conscience haunts him twenty-five years after the fact. An overzealous sanitation officer goes haywire. Levitt saves a child from certain danger.

title: Possession
description: A disorderly conduct report leads to a man who insists he's possessed by an evil spirit. A husband is arrested for forcing his wife into designer jeans.

title: Stress Analyzer
description: A Peace Corps recruiter goes overboard at a job fair. Dietrich volunteers for a department stress experiment.

title: Games
description: A computer game processor manufacturer is accused of espionage. An U. S. Army Specialist supplements her income as a prostitute.

title: Homeless
description: The precinct is overrun with vagrants on Christmas. A merchant uses a cattle rod as his weapon of choice. A greeting card writer snaps.

title: The Tontine
description: The survivor of a tontine attempts suicide so he can leave the money to his cousin.

title: Examination Day
description: The detectives work in uniform while Levitt and the others take their sergeant's exams. While working with the squad, Luger is overly rough with a perpetrator, and later with Barney.

title: The Clown
description: Street clowns are being attacked by a serial mugger. A hundred inmates are secretly evacuated from holding in the middle of the night.

roles.char: William Krebs aka Bingo the Clown

title: Chinatown: Part 1
description: Harris and Dietrich are forced to share an apartment in seclusion with an unco-operative murder witness until he talks. Lieutenant Scanlon falls for a wealthy mugging victim.

title: Chinatown: Part 2
description: Harris and Dietrich drive each other ever crazier as they continue to be confined to their hotel room with their unco-operative witness. Lieutenant Scanlon's wealthy target of affection files harassment charges against him.

title: Hunger Strike
description: A nuclear activist goes on a hunger strike to protest the nuclear arms race. Dietrich aids an elderly psychiatric patient who may be speaking a foreign language. Barney declines a deputy inspector nomination.

title: The Arrival
description: A disgruntled member burglarizes MENSA headquarters.

title: Obituary
description: A newspaper obituary creates a commotion when the subject is discovered to be alive. The detectives arrest a modern-day chicken thief.

title: Inquiry
description: Internal Affairs is called in when an arrest target levels a charge of excessive force against Wojo. An angry parent takes action when an exclusive kindergarten denies admission to his child.

title: Old Love
description: Dietrich's old flame pays him a visit. A former child actor hits his agent with a telephone.

title: Altercation
description: The Harris-Ripner conflict reaches a boiling point. A mugging victim confesses to a twenty-five- year-old crush on Barney.

title: Bones
description: A museum presses charges when an Indian lifts his tribe's ancestral bones from an exhibit. A scoutmaster catches a mugger.

title: Landmark: Part 1
description: Wojo's discovery of an ancient weapon results in a buyer expressing interest in the precinct building.

title: Landmark: Part 2
description: The interested buyer purchases the precinct building. Dietrich arrests the head of a crime school. Luger tries to bail out on his mail-order bride.

title: Landmark: Part 3
description: Everyone drops by to pay their last respects as the detectives prepare for new assignments. Harris contemplates resignation when he's assigned to Flushing Meadows. Barney recalls departed friends before he turns out the lights for the final time.
